definition: to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: When he offered me a cigarette, I couldn't help falling into temptation.
sentences.chinese: 当他给我递烟时，我禁不住受了诱惑。

sentences.english: As he sat down, he couldn’t resist another look at the lovely woman.
sentences.chinese: 坐下之后，他禁不住再次看了一眼这位美丽的女士。

sentences.english: Looking at the baby's rosy cheeks, his mother smiles.
sentences.chinese: 望着宝宝那粉嫩的小脸，做妈妈的禁不住笑了。

sentences.english: I couldn't help being concerned about the disappointment in Becky's eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我总禁不住想到贝姬眼里流露出的扫兴。

sentences.english: She can't help crying at a sad movie.
sentences.chinese: 她看了忧伤的电影禁不住要哭。

sentences.english: My hand hurt because I could not stop gripping my towel.
sentences.chinese: 我的手很疼，因为我总是禁不住要抓我的毛巾。

sentences.english: Hearing the news, they can not help jumping for joy.
sentences.chinese: 他们听到这消息时禁不住欢跳起来。

sentences.english: He was hit so bitterly that he could not help pitching forward.
sentences.chinese: 他被重重地击了一下，禁不住向前倒去。

sentences.english: I could not hinder myself from pondering on the question-Had he had fair play?
sentences.chinese: 我自己禁不住在思忖着，他可曾受到公平的待遇？

sentences.english: One thing I learnt and I can't help to share is the "cash-counting".
sentences.chinese: 有一件我学到并且我禁不住想分离的事情是点钞。

sentences.english: West chicken finally could not help the dead to tie up lousy dozen of south, agreed to have children and to the south.
sentences.chinese: 西凤终于禁不住向南的死缠烂打，同意和向南生孩子。

sentences.english: The director and I walked out, both of us crying.
sentences.chinese: 主任和我走了出去，我们两个人都禁不住流下了眼泪。

sentences.english: I could't help lauding the God's benefaction of salvation.
sentences.chinese: 我禁不住赞美我主的救恩。

sentences.english: Langdon could not help but feel a deep sense of loss at the curator's death.
sentences.chinese: 对于馆长的死，兰登禁不住有一种怅然若失的感受。

sentences.english: The late rice cannot stand frost .
When you watch Zhao Benshan's program, you can't help laughing.
sentences.chinese: 当你看肇本山的节目时，你会禁不住大笑起来。

definition: overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
to have heard what was said
